description:
Technopolitics refers to the strategic practice of designing or using technology for political goals.  However, even as the design of technological artifacts and systems may reflect a variety of interests, the material and cultural power of artifacts and systems often exceeds or escapes those intentions making for a complex and 
uncertain social landscape.  This module offers an overview of technopolitical interactions in Southeast Asia and a vision of Southeast Asia as a technological society.  Issues to be covered include technological nationalism, development as technique, infrastructure, risk, climate change, the digital revolution, and bio-security.
title: Technopolitics in Southeast Asia
